verses.roman:
nandas tu saha gopālair
bṛhatyā pūjayārcitaḥ
kṛṣṇa-rāmograsenādyair
nyavātsīd bandhu-vatsalaḥ

synonyms: nandaḥ—Nanda Mahārāja; tu—and; saha—together with; gopālaiḥ—the cowherds; bṛhatyā—especially opulent; pūjayā—with worship; arcitaḥ—honored; kṛṣṇa-rāma-ugrasena-ādyaiḥ—by Kṛṣṇa, Balarāma, Ugrasena and the others; nyavātsīt—stayed; bandhu—to his relatives; vatsalaḥ—affectionate.
translation: Nanda Mahārāja showed his affection for his relatives, the Yadus, by remaining with them a little longer, together with his cowherds. During his stay, Kṛṣṇa, Balarāma, Ugrasena and the others honored him with especially opulent worship.
